member.name: T:JetBrains.Util.NoReorder
member.summary: Prevents the Member Reordering feature from tossing members of the marked class.
member.remarks: The attribute must be mentioned in your member reordering patterns.

member.summary: Indicates that the value of marked element could never be null

summary.para: Utilities for working with a set of properties defined in an MSBuild file. Base for tasks to expose them to other medias (C#, WiX, etc).

member.summary: The case-insensitive tag that means the platform #define value must be overridden in the product (or TeamCity, for that matter).

member.summary: Props from the MSBuild file.

member.summary: Required. Gets or sets the path to the MSBuild Project file that defines the properties that should be exposed to a CLR language.

member.name: M:JetBrains.Build.Common.Infra.MsbuildPropertiesBase.Property.GetTypedValue
member.summary: MSbuild property values are strings. Coerces such string to the actual property value (property type is encoded in the property name). Also checks for leftover MustOverride tags.
Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:JetBrains.Build.Common.Infra.MsbuildPropertiesBase.PropertyTypedValue.#ctor(JetBrains.Build.Common.Infra.MsbuildPropertiesBase.Property,JetBrains.Build.Common.Infra.MsbuildPropertiesBase.PropertyType,System.Object)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:JetBrains.Build.Common.Infra.MsbuildPropertiesBase.PropertyTypedValue.EmitInitExpression(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Emits init expression for a field to set it to this value.
member.param: Const version (some kind of reasonable string substitute for non-primitive types).

summary.para: Takes a set of properties defined in an MSBuild file, and turns them into code in some programming language (eg C#).
This emulates #defines-with-values, like in C++, that are missing from C#.

Only the statically-evaluated property values are considered. You can reference environment variables to allow overrides on a build server, eg TeamCity %env% properties. You can include other MSBuild files, eg to override default values (without TeamCity) defined in the Platform by your Product-specific default values.

The algorithm takes any properties defined in global Property Groups and takes their evaluated value. The CLR type is inferred from the property name prefix: "Is" means a Boolean, "Num" means an Int32, and so on.

member.name: M:JetBrains.Build.Common.Tasks.MsbuildPropertiesToCode.EmitClass_Props(System.CodeDom.CodeTypeDeclaration,System.CodeDom.CodeTypeDeclaration,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{JetBrains.Build.Common.Infra.MsbuildPropertiesBase.Property})
member.summary: Fields for props into the classes.

member.name: M:JetBrains.Build.Common.Tasks.MsbuildPropertiesToCode.EmitClass_Props_Field(JetBrains.Build.Common.Infra.MsbuildPropertiesBase.Property,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a full field decl for a single prop field.

member.name: M:JetBrains.Build.Common.Tasks.MsbuildPropertiesToCode.ExecuteTask
member.summary: The method to be overriden in inheriting tasks. Throw an exception in case of an errror.

member.name: P:JetBrains.Build.Common.Tasks.MsbuildPropertiesToCode.ClassName
member.summary: Required. Gets or sets the full CLR name of the generated class.

member.name: P:JetBrains.Build.Common.Tasks.MsbuildPropertiesToCode.OutputFile
member.summary: Required. Gets or sets the name of the output file in a CLR language. The file extension defines the language.

summary.para: Takes a set of properties defined in an MSBuild file, and turns them into an MSBuild ItemGroup.

Only the statically-evaluated property values are considered. You can reference environment variables to allow overrides on a build server, eg TeamCity %env% properties. You can include other MSBuild files, eg to override default values (without TeamCity) defined in the Platform by your Product-specific default values.

The algorithm takes any properties defined in global Property Groups and takes their evaluated value. The CLR type is inferred from the property name prefix: "Is" means a Boolean, "Num" means an Int32, and so on.

member.name: M:JetBrains.Build.Common.Tasks.MsbuildPropertiesToItemGroup.CreateTaskItem(JetBrains.Build.Common.Infra.MsbuildPropertiesBase.Property)
member.summary: Creates a task item, fills up with metadata. This is also where the typed value is extracted from the property, and related exceptions might occur.

summary.para: Gets the resulting items corresponding to the #defined properties.
Metadata:
• Name: Name of the property, including the type-inferring prefix.

• ValueOriginal: The property value, right out of the MSBuild Property Group evaluator. Basically the string written in the MSBuild file (or TeamCity overrides), as is, but for any possible macros etc.

• ValueConstString: The property value, parsed and coerced to whatever property type was inferred from the property name, converted then to a C# literal value, as would be used in the Defines::Const C# class (non-string literal values, like ints or bools, are coerced to invariant strings).

member.summary: Processes a single file.

member.summary: The method to be overriden in inheriting tasks. Throw an exception in case of an errror.

member.name: P:JetBrains.Build.Common.Tasks.ReplaceTextEx.CaseSensitive
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the search should be case-sensitive.

member.name: P:JetBrains.Build.Common.Tasks.ReplaceTextEx.InputFiles
member.summary: Gets or sets the files to read for replacing the text.

member.name: P:JetBrains.Build.Common.Tasks.ReplaceTextEx.OutputFiles
member.summary: Gets or sets the files to write the results into. Must correspond to .

summary.para: Gets or sets the list of patterns to perform the replace against.
The item spec is insignificant. The What metadata represents the search pattern, and With metadata represents the replacement string.
Either this or must be specified.
Gets or sets the list of patterns to perform the replace against.

Each pattern is a pair of strings. The first one represents the search pattern, and the second one represents the replacement string. Strings are separated with U+001E (RS, Record Separator) chars, both within the pair and between the pairs.
Either this or must be specified.

member.name: M:JetBrains.Build.Common.Tasks.GetNativeFileVersion.VersionDll.GetFileVersionInfoSizeW(System.String,System.UInt32*)
member.summary: Determines whether the operating system can retrieve version information for a specified file. If version information is available, returns the size, in bytes, of that information.
member.param: [in] Pointer to a null-terminated string that specifies the name of the file of interest. The function uses the search sequence specified by the LoadLibrary function. Windows 95/98/Me: The short path form of the specified file name must be less than 126 characters.
[out] Pointer to a variable that the function sets to zero.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is the size, in bytes, of the file's version information. If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: M:JetBrains.Build.Common.Tasks.GetNativeFileVersion.VersionDll.GetFileVersionInfoW(System.String,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.Void*)
member.summary: Retrieves version information for the specified file.
member.param: [in] Pointer to a null-terminated string that specifies the name of the file of interest. If a full path is not specified, the function uses the search sequence specified by the LoadLibrary function.Windows 95/98/Me: The short path form of the specified file name must be less than 126 characters.

[in] Specifies the size, in bytes, of the buffer pointed to by the lpData parameter. Call the function first to determine the size, in bytes, of a file's version information. The dwLen member should be equal to or greater than that value. If the buffer pointed to by lpData is not large enough, the function truncates the file's version information to the size of the buffer.
[out] Pointer to a buffer that receives the file-version information. You can use this value in a subsequent call to the function to retrieve data from the buffer.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero. If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: M:JetBrains.Build.Common.Tasks.GetNativeFileVersion.VersionDll.VerQueryValueW(System.Void*,System.String,System.Void**,System.UInt32*)
member.summary: The function retrieves specified version information from the specified version-information resource. To retrieve the appropriate resource, before you call , you must first call the function, and then the function.
member.param: [in] Pointer to the buffer containing the version-information resource returned by the function.

[in] Pointer to a zero-terminated string specifying which version-information value to retrieve. The string must consist of names separated by backslashes (\) and it must have one of the following forms.
\
Specifies the root block. The function retrieves a pointer to the VS_FIXEDFILEINFO structure for the version-information resource.
\VarFileInfo\Translation
Specifies the translation array in a Var variable information structure—the Value member of this structure. The function retrieves a pointer to this array of language and code page identifiers. An application can use these identifiers to access a language-specific StringTable /// structure (using the szKey member) in the version-information resource.
\StringFileInfo\lang-codepage\string-name
Specifies a value in a language-specific StringTable structure. The lang-codepage name is a concatenation of a language and code page identifier pair found as a DWORD in the translation array for the resource. Here the lang-codepage name must be specified as a hexadecimal string. The string-name name must be one of the predefined strings described in the following Remarks section. The function retrieves a string value specific to the language and code page indicated.

[out] When this method returns, contains the address of a pointer to the requested version information in the buffer pointed to by pBlock. The memory pointed to by lplpBuffer is freed when the associated pBlock memory is freed.

[out] When this method returns, contains a pointer to the size of the requested data pointed to by lplpBuffer: for version information values, the length in TCHARs of the string stored at lplpBuffer; for translation array values, the size in bytes of the array stored at lplpBuffer; and for root block, the size in bytes of the structure.
member.returns: If the specified version-information structure exists, and version information is available, the return value is nonzero. If the address of the length buffer is zero, no value is available for the specified version-information name. If the specified name does not exist or the specified resource is not valid, the return value is zero.

member.name: M:JetBrains.Build.Common.Tasks.GetNativeFileVersion.VersionDll.Helpers.GetFileVersion(System.IO.FileInfo)

member.name: P:JetBrains.Build.Common.Tasks.RegSetValue.ValueType
member.summary: Optional. The Registry value type, as of the enumeration. is the default.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Build.Common.Tasks.RemoveItemsInFolder
member.summary: Scans through the item group and removes any items that fall under the given folder.

member.name: M:JetBrains.Build.Common.Tasks.RemoveItemsInFolder.ExecuteTask
member.summary: The method to be overriden in inheriting tasks. Throw an exception in case of an errror.

member.name: P:JetBrains.Build.Common.Tasks.RemoveItemsInFolder.Directory
member.summary: Specifies the directory files in which (recursively) should be excluded from .

member.name: P:JetBrains.Build.Common.Tasks.RemoveItemsInFolder.Items
member.summary: Specifies the list of the files to be filtered down. Note: you should not be using the same item group for input and output, as the output contributes to the item group but would not replace it.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Build.Common.Tasks.TlbExp
member.summary: Exports a .NET Assembly as a COM Type Library. A possible use is checking the assemblies for COM validness so that their CCW aren't gonna have any problems in runtime.

member.name: P:JetBrains.Build.Common.Tasks.TlbExp.InputFile
member.summary: Specifies the .NET Assembly to convert to a COM Type Library.

member.name: P:JetBrains.Build.Common.Tasks.TlbExp.OutDir
member.summary: Specifies the resulting COM Type Library file directory. A default TLB file name is used, based on the assembly name. Either this or must be specified.

member.name: P:JetBrains.Build.Common.Tasks.TlbExp.OutputFile
member.summary: Specifies the resulting COM Type Library file. Either this or must be specified.

member.name: P:JetBrains.Build.Common.Tasks.TlbExp.ReferencesDir
member.summary: Optional. Specifies the list of folders to look for assembly references.

member.name: P:JetBrains.Build.Common.Tasks.TlbExp.Silent
member.summary: Whether the tool output should be silent.

member.name: P:JetBrains.Build.Common.Tasks.TlbExp.Verbose
member.summary: Whether the tool output should be verbose.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Build.Common.Tasks.TypeLibExport
member.summary: Exports a set of .NET Assemblies as COM Type Libraries. A possible use is checking the assemblies for COM validness so that their CCW aren't gonna have any problems in runtime.

member.name: M:JetBrains.Build.Common.Tasks.TypeLibExport.ExportTypeLib(Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem,Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem,System.Func{System.String[],System.Int32},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Runs ExportTypeLib for a single item.

member.name: M:JetBrains.Build.Common.Tasks.TypeLibExport.LoadTlbExpTool
member.summary: Loads the MS implementation. We cannot use the class from System.Reflection right away and prefer to use the TlbExp tool code because it constructs a new AppDomain into which the assembly being exported is loaded (and unloaded). This way, the assembly is not locked on disk.

member.name: M:JetBrains.Build.Common.Tasks.TypeLibExport.ExecuteTask
member.summary: The method to be overriden in inheriting tasks. Throw an exception in case of an errror.

member.name: P:JetBrains.Build.Common.Tasks.TypeLibExport.InputFiles
member.summary: Specifies the list of .NET Assemblies to convert to COM Type Libraries.

member.name: P:JetBrains.Build.Common.Tasks.TypeLibExport.OutputFiles
member.summary: Specifies the list of resulting COM Type Library files. Each item in the list must correspond to an item in the list.

member.name: P:JetBrains.Build.Common.Tasks.TypeLibExport.Silent
member.summary: Whether the tool output should be silent.

member.name: P:JetBrains.Build.Common.Tasks.TypeLibExport.Verbose
member.summary: Whether the tool output should be verbose.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Build.Common.Tasks.CopyFirstAttempt
member.summary: Overrides the Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Copy task.

member.name: M:JetBrains.Build.Common.Tasks.CopyFirstAttempt.CopyFileIfNeeded(Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem,Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem)
member.summary: Checks whether the file needs to be copied. Does it, if needed.

member.name: M:JetBrains.Build.Common.Tasks.CopyFirstAttempt.ExecuteTask
member.summary: The method to be overriden in inheriting tasks. Throw an exception in case of an errror.

member.name: P:JetBrains.Build.Common.Tasks.CopyFirstAttempt.CopiedFiles
member.summary: Contains the items that were successfully copied.

member.name: P:JetBrains.Build.Common.Tasks.CopyFirstAttempt.DestinationFiles
member.summary: Specifies the list of files to copy the source files to. This list is expected to be a one-to-one mapping with the list specified in the SourceFiles parameter. That is, the first file specified in SourceFiles will be copied to the first location specified in DestinationFiles, and so forth.

member.name: P:JetBrains.Build.Common.Tasks.CopyFirstAttempt.DestinationFolder
member.summary: Specifies the directory to which you want to copy the files. This must be a directory, not a file. If the directory does not exist, it is created automatically.

member.name: P:JetBrains.Build.Common.Tasks.CopyFirstAttempt.OverwriteReadOnlyFiles
member.summary: Overwrite files even if they are marked as read only files.

member.name: P:JetBrains.Build.Common.Tasks.CopyFirstAttempt.SkipUnchangedFiles
member.summary: If true, skips the copying of files that are unchanged between the source and destination. The Copy task considers files to be unchanged if they have the same size and the same last modified time. If you set this parameter to true, you should not use dependency analysis on the containing target, because that only runs the task if the last-modified times of the source files are newer than the last-modified times of the destination files.

member.name: P:JetBrains.Build.Common.Tasks.CopyFirstAttempt.SourceFiles
member.summary: Specifies the files to copy.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Build.Common.Tasks.CreatePublisherPolicyBuildFile
member.summary: Generates the publisher policy assemblies for the given set of assemblies and their specific versions.

member.name: M:JetBrains.Build.Common.Tasks.CreatePublisherPolicyBuildFile.AssertVersionComponents(System.Version,System.Int32)
member.summary: Ensures that version has at least components defined.

member.name: M:JetBrains.Build.Common.Tasks.CreatePublisherPolicyBuildFile.ExecuteTask
member.summary: The method to be overriden in inheriting tasks. Throw an exception in case of an errror.

member.name: P:JetBrains.Build.Common.Tasks.CreatePublisherPolicyBuildFile.InputFiles
member.summary: Lists the assemblies for which the policies should be generated.

member.name: P:JetBrains.Build.Common.Tasks.CreatePublisherPolicyBuildFile.IntDir
member.summary: Specifies the intermediate folder in which the config files should be created.

member.name: P:JetBrains.Build.Common.Tasks.CreatePublisherPolicyBuildFile.KeyFile
member.summary: Specifies the key file to sign the publisher policy assemblies with; must correspond to the key that was used to sign the original assembly.

member.name: P:JetBrains.Build.Common.Tasks.CreatePublisherPolicyBuildFile.OutDir
member.summary: Specifies the output folder into which the resulting assemblies will be written.

member.name: P:JetBrains.Build.Common.Tasks.CreatePublisherPolicyBuildFile.OutputFile
member.summary: Specifies the output MSBuild project file that will be generated by this task.

member.name: P:JetBrains.Build.Common.Tasks.CreatePublisherPolicyBuildFile.SourceVersionHigh
member.summary: The upper boundary of the source versions range for the publisher policy. Optional; if missed, the actual version of the assembly will be used.

member.name: P:JetBrains.Build.Common.Tasks.CreatePublisherPolicyBuildFile.SourceVersionLow
member.summary: The lower boundary of the source versions range for the publisher policy. Required.

member.name: P:JetBrains.Build.Common.Tasks.CreatePublisherPolicyBuildFile.TargetVersion
member.summary: The target version for the publisher policy. Optional; if missed, the actual version of the assembly will be used.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Build.Common.Tasks.GetCustomVersion
member.summary: Gets the custom version number based on the current date and time. This way, each new build gets its own build number (provided that they don't run too often). The generated version components have the WORD size.

member.name: P:JetBrains.Build.Common.Tasks.GetCustomVersion.BaseDate
member.summary: The base date, in UTC, written against ISO-8601. The difference in time from the base date is used to produce the version number, see output parameters for details. It is recommended that it be in the past.

member.name: P:JetBrains.Build.Common.Tasks.GetCustomVersion.Build
member.summary: The Build version number component. This component is dynamic and equal to the number of full days between the current date and , UTC. If the number is negative, it overlaps FFFF.

member.name: P:JetBrains.Build.Common.Tasks.GetCustomVersion.Major
member.summary: The Major version number component. This component is not dynamic. If you set an input value for this property, it will be used for the output(unless 0, which is treated as "Not Set"). If the input value is not set or 0, the output value of 1 will be used.

member.name: P:JetBrains.Build.Common.Tasks.GetCustomVersion.Minor
member.summary: The Minor version number component. This component is not dynamic. If you set an input value for this property, it will be used. If the input value is not set, the output value of 0 will be used.

member.name: P:JetBrains.Build.Common.Tasks.GetCustomVersion.Revision
member.summary: The Revision version number component. This component is dynamic and grows proportionally from 0 to FFFF within one number.

member.name: P:JetBrains.Build.Common.Tasks.GetCustomVersion.Version4
member.summary: Gets the dot-separated four-component version number, {Major}.{Minor}.{Build}.{Revision}.
